intro: Neoporteria lindleyi f. curvispina, commonly known as the curly-spined neoporteria, is a unique variant of the neoporteria genus. It is characterized by its distinctive, curved spines that give it a striking appearance. The plant belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes a wide range of flowering plants. Its foliage is typically lance-shaped with a smooth texture, and it produces small, inconspicuous flowers. This plant is often cultivated for its ornamental value and interesting morphology.
